item.title: x86 Assembly Note
item.description: x86-Assembly note Registers eight 32-bit general purpose registers When referring to registers in assembly language, the names are not case-sensitive. Memory and Addressing Modes Declaring Static Data Regions Data declarations should be preceded by the .DATA directive. located in memory next to one another. DB—one byte DW—two bytes DD—four bytes Example .DATA var DB 64 ; _Declare a byte, referred to as location var, containing the value 64.
